result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  This case was dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes in 15CM71.

Bond includes cases: 15CM71 and 15CM191:  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: S. K. or his family,residence or place of employment.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2016 at 10:00 am.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Sebion appeared in court.  Attorney Sebion requesting to be set for plea/sentencing ASAP.  Asking for one more chance for a signature bond.  State objects to a modification of the bond.  Court denied the request.  Bond remains as previously ordered.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Sebion.  Attorney Sebion wants to address bond.  Defendant will need to appear.
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  No counsel present. Cash bond set.  AIA set for 6/20 at 3 pm.  Defendant advised to contact his attorney.
Status conference on June 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Bond includes cases 15CM71 and 15CM191:  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: S. K. or his family,residence or place of employment.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
